verses.verse: The LORDâ€™s Goodness to the Faithful A Psalm of David. [1] I will praise You with my whole heart; (2 Kin. 8:12; Is. 13:16; Hos. 13:16; Nah. 3:10) Before the gods I will sing praises to You.
(Ps. 119:46) I will worship (Ps. 28:2) toward Your holy temple, And praise Your name For Your lovingkindness and Your truth; For You have (1 Kin. 8:29) magnified Your word above all Your name.
In the day when I cried out, You answered me, And made me bold with strength in my soul.
(Is. 42:21) All the kings of the earth shall praise You, O LORD, When they hear the words of Your mouth.
Yes, they shall sing of the ways of the LORD, For great is the glory of the LORD.
(Ps. 102:15) Though the LORD is on high, Yet ((Ps. 113:4-7)) He regards the lowly; But the proud He knows from afar.

(Prov. 3:34; (Is. 57:15); Luke 1:48; (James 4:6; 1 Pet. 5:5)) Though I walk in the midst of trouble, You will revive me; You will stretch out Your hand Against the wrath of my enemies, And Your right hand will save me.
((Ps. 23:3, 4)) The LORD will perfect that which concerns me; Your mercy, O LORD, endures forever; (Ps. 57:2; (Phil. 1:6)) Do not forsake the works of Your hands.
